Comment:
Well I have been following all the courses by Durga sir. But after learning bigdata now I was looking to learn more on cloud side. How things work in cloud in AWS. Although at one point I got stuck at one of the installation process, so I asked for Help and Durga sir by himself came 1 on 1 to resolve my issue. So this is the best thing I have seen. Person is so dedicated to whatever he does. You will not feel as if you have taken a online course for few bucks but rather it will give you a classroom feeling.
I would highly recommend if you are new to aws and looking for hands on to learn and grow

Comment:
Overall, the course was average. 
Pros: 
1. It focused well on the API's part and that is good. That is major portion of the real exam. 
Cons: 
1. Should have better content in architecture part. 
2. Garbage collection related topic is missing. There are couple of questions related to that also in the exam .
3. Should have explained the answers in the practice paper.
4. Should have additional practice papers for practice.

Course Name: Spark SQL and Spark 3 using Scala Hands-On with Labs
Data Engineering Essentials using SQL, Python, and PySpark
Data Engineering Essentials using SQL, Python, and PySpark
Comment:
The course is too long, and many things are too rambling and out of focus.
- I really hope this course can provide basic knowledge as well as a project on data engineering. But nevertheless n has too much rambling knowledge
- you did very well the sql part also python. But there's really no need to be so detailed
- in hadoop and spark, it's too fast and lacks details
- I've seen videos that are cut and don't follow what you show in the course.
- in the hadoop and spark section you explain very confusingly, most of what you show I can't follow because of the lack of interactivity
- nothing is clear

Comment:
if you want to take this class seriously, you must have very solid background knowledge about Unix/Linux, relational database, general programming skill set.  if you are a junior developer, you will feel very frustrated and will quit the class very quickly. It is not your fault, it is due the content of this class itself.

I have learned lots from this class and build a solid knowledge about HDFS/HIVE/IMPALA/SQOOP, which I can apply back to my daily work.

it is one of the longest class I have taken so far from Udemy and you need commit solid time to complete this class.

I will highly recommend this class; but you have to be prepared.

The lecturer is certainly good at data engineering but lecturing is not his strong suite. He speaks terribly fast and makes the impression that he just wants to get it over with. It is a pity because the curriculum DOES look interesting. Nevertheless, I am not going to continue this and I regret I missed the deadline for refund.

Comment:
This course is interesting but the amount of time spent on setup before getting into the actual subject matter is too long.
It is interesting to learn about cloud setup and IPs and ports and firewalls but the reality of most workplaces is that data engineers or analysts will not have access to any of that or be the ones charged with doing the setup. There are specialists that handle that. 
This course should set up a virtual box VM that they distribute with the course so that students can jump right into the subject matter. 
I am into hour 3 now and am still setting up learning about public IP and private IP.
I am incredibly frustrated with this course.
2nd entry - I got this course on sale and I am still asking for my money back.
I have done 35/600 videos and spent close to 3 hours and it is still the setup to begin the training.

Course Name: Data Engineering using Databricks on AWS and Azure
Comment: Excellent course! But it would be much better having real example of loading data from several sources/ The course gives the beginning knowlrdge of how things are done, but the cherry on top would be the mini-project. E.g. we have two different sources, pushing similar entity to DataLake and we need to join them to build silver layer. It should show how real deals are done with DB. And also this course has toooo much repeats in videos which student should scroll cause he already seen it many times. Such as 'copying files to s3' and so. They easily can be replaced by text, describing what we have done and the result we are expecting to see, and this can be in form of notebook. Also there could be description what to do with *.dbc files attached in main course description. Also i should say that speech transcription frequently differs from teacher saying and what teacher saying sometimes differs from Classic English spoken language due to strong accent, but to the end of the course i get used to it =) Nevertheless the course is Great! Thank you Very Much!

Course Name: DevOps Series - Setup Environment using Virtual Machines
Comment:
Great course on Vagrant with walkthroughs of installing and configuring Vagrant on Linux and VirtualBox.  I would have liked to see more on the theory, structure and language of Vagrant files, however.
The course recommends using OVH to rent servers, but the costs seem a bit too expensive, it might be cheaper to buy a second-hand server to practice on (such as an HP DL380 G6/7) which could be the cost of a 1-month subscription to OVH).
Looking forward to the other courses.

Databricks Essentials for Spark Developers (Azure and AWS)
Comment:
Overall it's good but I was expecting somewhat more. Few pointer below:
1.Too much of time spent in emphasizing the fact that this course is not meant for basics and people who want to learn more should register into the other basic courses provided by itversity. It's unnecessary to repeat the same thing over and again.
2. The course can be updated with a better datamodel. The one chosen from cloudera is no more available in cloudera site.
3. More details can be provided as to how the internals of databricks cloud is working
4. Not much information provided how we can run mashup of both (scala & sql) or (python & sql) with temp views created on spark and then use them in further processing
5. Not much information provided on how community edition is using hive with DBFS
6. Scheduling of notebooks with parameters not shown

Below topics can be added for us to understand real world scenarios better.
1. How to schedule a job that will consume data from azure data lake and process in databricks and write in datalake
2. How to mount azure blob storage with databricks and use it further

The material was thorough and helped me pass the CCA-175 exam with a perfect score. I used this course as my primary tool for studying for the CCA-175 exam. I followed along using ITVersity labs for the better part of 4 weeks (and took some extra time for practice problems).

I would recommend this course for anybody who is serious about getting certified or just wants to significantly improve their big data skills.

Comment:
It is very heard to understand the instructor because of the terrible audio quality and the accent. If the audio quality was not so bad I wouldn't have much issue with the accent. Many of the lessons are clearly cut, so there are no breaks from the speaker and I feel like things are missed between those pieces that are cut. There is a lot of great information that is glazed over and spoken about so quickly that with the accent and bad audio quality, it took several times to even hear what the instructor was saying. In addition, when the a video ends, it automatically begins playing the next video halfway through. Each time, I have to start the video over from the beginning which seems like a technical problem that could easily be resolved to improve this course.
Adding subtitles or resources that are accessible within Udemy would be helpful as well. The course could be excellent but these things mentioned above make the course almost unbearable.

Important concepts of Kafka like Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, KSQL were missing. Hope these gets included soon. Including these will make the course a great one.

Comment:
Overall this is a good course if you are buy a subscription for the itversity cluster. The instructor is very good, he assumed no prior knowledge of the subject which makes this perfect for beginners.  He has put a lot of work into this.
If you are using cloudera quickstart VM you are going to run into a lot of issues. There is little support and if you have little experience using linux system the task becomes almost impossible. You will spend countless of hours trying to setup the quickstart vm etc.
The first part of setting the intellij with sbt is not relevant to the rest of the course and and is a nightmare to get it working.

Comment: The course was very thorough. I learned a lot in this course. I think the course could be simplified a bit by by listing the main points. There is lot of repetition of code, so highlighting only the differential part would have been sufficient. One thing I liked the about the course which is different than other course is that the instructor teaches you how to resolve problems and understand the help commands. I don't think any course does that. I took another course which was much simpler to first understand the basics. After finishing that course, I started this course to get a deep understanding of the concepts. It is not that this course doesn't teach you basics but it gets overwhelming for a newbie at times. I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to get involved with learning big data technologies in greater details.

Comment: It is one of the most comprehensive courses on certification. I have enrolled in a few related courses on Udemy  but by far found this to be the best one. There is some room for improvement. First is that the notes give very little and generic information. I usually watch videos first for the concepts and then practice using the notes. However, in the course, the notes have outlines only. I saw that there is a list of commands after each section which is good. However, it would be better if there is an example below the commands. A better option is still to show examples in notes but if it can't be done there, example in end of the section (under HDFS Resources and exercises) will be very helpful. Also, solutions to the exercises should be provided. Finally, last but not as important , if the instructor can speak little bit slowly. Reducing the speed on Udemy portal makes it too slow. I have only gone through first section. I will update as I progress.

Actually, this set of practise tests was released just a week before my scheduled exam date. I have now postponed the exam date by 2 weeks just so I can practise. Other than this, I have not seen any other tests available at all. This type of practise is a must.

In my case, I have lots of software development experience, but no big data experience. So all of this is very new to me, but with Durga's udemy course, I have been able to learn a lot.

This test is golden, and a MUST for people taking the exam! Many thanks to Durga sir and the itversity team for all their help.

Hello Durga sir,

I learned Big Data technologies by following your videos. I have completed your 'CCA 175 - Spark and Hadoop Developer Certification - Scala' in Udemy. I got the confidence to appear for the CCA 175 exam. Thanks a lot for creating excellent content.I was excited to see the your CCA 175 Practice test course, but expected the solutions also. Please share the solutions.It would be a great help for me to take CCA 175 exam. Thanks a lot. I appreciate your great effort.

Durga Viswanatha Raju Gadiraju (Instructor), 3 days ago

I am planning to add one more section with retakes. As part of retakes, I have provided solutions as well. Udemy does not facilitate to retake the assignments and hence you have to go to next section to retake the exams. As part of Solutions we have provided the solution as per our approach along with validation steps. Please check the 2 assignments which are added. I will be adding third one soon.

Thank you Durga Sir,

I'll work on these solutions.
Thanks for considering my concern and adding the solution in the course.
I appreciate you effort and sincerity.

Thanks and regards,
Arivoli

Please keep putting out solid, industry-relevant content!

Course Name: Spark SQL and Spark 3 using Scala Hands-On with Labs
Comment:
I have finished this course recently. A very good real time examples explained in details. I have set up my own cluster and did practice. I love instructor effort a lot. This course is not for absolute beginner. He must have some prior knowledge into Big Data world and its eco-system. It will be very useful for them who didn't have practice well.

Please do have this course into your bucket if you want to clear the exam. I have already purchased few courses from him and finished almost all. Got very nice grip.

Subrat Gupta

Course Name: AWS EMR and Spark 2 using Scala
Apache Sqoop for Data Ingestion into Hadoop HDFS
HDPCD:Spark using Scala
Spark SQL and Spark 3 using Scala Hands-On with Labs
Build streaming applications using Apache Kafka and Scala
Comment:
The experience thus far is pretty terrible.  The video fades in and out of focus, remaining out of focus for more than 70% of the video time.  This makes it difficult as you cannot pause when lengthy commands are being issued and replicate them as the video is out of focus and the command is not legible.  Usually the transcripts are helpful but they are useless in this course.  

Most course have resources available for download (zips of code examples, transcripts, slides, etc) from Udemy.  This course forces you to a third party site (Itversity) which requires an additional login, etc.  The point of this appears to be to showcase other learning they have which is not available from Udemy which seems a bit shady.

The instructor seems knowledgable and the course would probably be fine if the video quality wasn't so awful.

Delightful rollercoster Experience at an economic price with an Elite takeaway.

Bought this course on  October. I have a Big Data background and had worked before few years back and currently practicing as a Data Scientist. I   Planned to Learn this to rehash my skills that i left 2.5years back and give a shot  on CCA175 on December Last , 2018. From beginning it was interesting and the way Durga sir had handled this was phenomenal. Instead of spending a planned 1 hour / day on this, i went beyond 2hrs and also purchased a month long itversity lab access for as low as 14.95$ for practicing and stayed well ahead of my planned schedule. And much to my surprise got the confidence towards 70% of course that i could clear the certification. Practiced whatever that is shown and went ahead cleared my CCA175 on December 1st itself (which is 3 weeks ahead) :) Simply Phenomenal stuff from Durga Sir. I had so much hestitation for the course and purchase of itversity labs , but now after my experience i would gladly recommend this to anyone who wants to gain a competitive edge by learning and showcasing skills :) 

Durga Sir you simply Rock!!!!!!!!!! Waiting for your new course on CCP  / CCA data analyst.

Course Name: Spark SQL and PySpark 3 using Python 3 Hands-On with Labs
HDPCD:Spark using Python (pyspark)
HDPCD:Spark using Python (pyspark)
Comment:
First - A good attempt by instructor and his team to cover the certification material in one Course.
Reasons for two and half star rating:
1. Instructor's lack of preparation is very evident. There are so many errors during execution of example and for few examples the results are complete wrong. e.g. accumulator section.
2. Starting sections only promotes itversity lab. There are other courses on Udemy where instructors provided introduction on how to connect to cluster etc. just one time at the beginning and after that it is all business. In this course almost till end of section 3 we have to hear about lab and how to connect. I completed the entire course of Hortonworks Sandbox without any issue. So no need to purchase access to labs.
3. Other courses on Udemy provides lifetime access to live cluster with purchase of course. This course provides 1 month access. I did not request one because Sandbox is good for course.
4. Extremely unprofessional presentation. There are notifications popping in between videos, phone ringing, low battery messages. Just horrible presentation.

Now let's discuss some good points of this course:
1. Since instructor made numerous errors while running code, it was irritating in beginning to see errors but then it was a good learning experience because if you pause the video and analyze them you learn more.
2. You get access to sample data and a scenario to code against. Can be easily found online but it was a good learning experience to go through scenario and practice exam objectives.
3. Instructor referred to spark documentation continuously which was great because eventually you also start referring to documentation and then during certification you know exactly the place to refer to in case there is some issue.

Comment:
Content and exercises are good and targeted for HDPCD Spark exam point of view, like the approach on straight to the point...

Looking forward to upgrade course content targeting HDPCD Spark 2.X rather than Spark 1.6 (Outdated)

Background noise during recordings; Improvement required on instructor communication and organizing the delivery and cut-short the length of session in effective way to keep the enthusiasm..

Please extend the 5 examples being covered by also elaborating with the details Spark UI Job execution details (by explaining the details of stages,tasks,executors etc after each exercise) to understand job execution clearly..It would help the job understand resource optimization even more better..

Free HDP Sandbox cluster available on cloud from Azure and Amazon  (with free subscription for 1 Month or 1 Year)..It could have been better if the exercises are demonstrated using either of those rather than your own itversity.com cluster..

This course has several problems:
  - It lacks a proper introduction to Hadoop and Big Data.
  - It's very hard to understand the instructor's accent, and there are no transcripts. On top of that, the sound is bad and there are background noises sometimes.
  - The classes lack previous preparation. The explanations are unclear, and sometimes even repeated throughout the video. There are classes where the instructor is trying to show a command, and it doesn't work, and we're just sitting there waiting for 3 seconds of complete silence, while he thinks what went wrong.

Definitely not worth the money.

Comment:
Durga Sir, have great amount of knowledge in this domain, he is explaining in a very practical way to understand easily.
I would say , it's one of the best courses on Udemy, which guide us for the certification. 

ITVersity is good learning platform & help to learn big data techologies.

Course Name: Spark SQL and PySpark 3 using Python 3 Hands-On with Labs
Comment:
PROS:
The course covers every part in detail and I would recommend this to everyone who is targetting to get Spark Hadoop certification.

CONS:
1. The only thing the bothers me is to buy the setup from Itversity, as part of this course it is provided for one month but after one month I have to buy the lab setup which cost me almost $15. So, in total this course cost me $65.00 which bothers me being a student with no source of income whatsoever.
2. There are many videos which have a repeated information, which might be necessary at times but not always.
3. For discussions, we are asked to post the queries to discuss.iteversity.com which I think is not required Udemy has already this thing covered, where you can ask questions lecture wise which is far more doable then log in to discuss.itversity.com and post the question.

Spark SQL and PySpark 3 using Python 3 Hands-On with Labs
Spark SQL and Spark 3 using Scala Hands-On with Labs
Comment: I waited until I finished the course to write this review.  You cannot properly evaluate a course after one or two lessons.  I think Udemy does this, because most people won't finish the course anyway, so they ask for reviews early in the course.  Anyway, this course is exactly what I needed. Durga, the instructor is experienced and gives in-depth explanations, and supporting information about coding, and frameworks, etc.  I took the CCA-175 before taking this course, about 2 months ago, and I did not pass. This course really clarified some things for me, like solving business cases using core Spark and Scala APIs vs. SQL and Data-frames.  I especially like Durga's course over others, because he actually shows you how to write the code in real-time, on-screen, and even makes mistakes, then corrects them.  Other courses simply move at light-speed through the material, using code they have already pre-written and debugged, and also without giving proper explanation and context.  Fortunately, Durga doesn't do this... This course is almost like being in a real classroom.  I am also an instructor, and have delivered technical classroom training on subjects like Linux and Solaris to fortune 500 companies around the country.  That being said, I appreciate the way Durga takes his time and clearly explains each topic, as well as telling you and showing you where to find additional information and resources.  I have attended real classroom training before taking this course, and sadly I learned more from Durga. I also bought two other Big Data courses on Udemy. One was good, but not as good as Durga's, and the other just plain bombed!  If you want to really learn how to code Hadoop, and Spark applications in Scala, especially how to write applications in Spark/Scala - get this course! It's the best one on Udemy!  You won't be sorry!  FYI: I also took an additional Scala Fundamentals course, and an SQL course while taking this one. I plan to sit for the CCA-175 again by the end of this month.  I hope this helps someone.
